name: Middle Carter Mountain

trails_config.name: Imp Trail Loop
trails_config.description: Provides the most efficient access to the Carter Ridge. The 'Imp Face' viewpoint offers a direct, head-on look at the Presidential Range's northern peaks.
trails_config.parking_info: Imp Trailhead Parking, NH-16, Gorham, NH

current_conditions.ai_summary: Experience the beauty of New Hampshire on Middle Carter Mountain. At 4610 feet, this summit commands impressive views of the surrounding wilderness.
risk_factors: Check local trail conditions before departing.
Start early to avoid afternoon storms.

generated_description:
The Experience

Standing at 4610 feet, Middle Carter Mountain is a standout peak in New Hampshire. Known for its rugged and challenging terrain, it offers a quintessential hiking experience.

The Challenge

Hikers often choose the **Imp Trail Loop**, a **6.3 mile** route gaining significant elevation. As part of the **NH48 4000-Footers**, it draws peak-baggers from across the region.

Peak Bagging Logic

**Peak Bagging Opportunity:** Consider connecting this hike with **South Carter Mountain**, which is just 0.7 miles away. Linking these peaks is a popular way to maximize your day on the trail.
